metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3511 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ssl23_get_client_hello function in s23_srvr.c in OpenSSL 1.0.1 before 1.0.1i allows man-in-the-middle attackers to force the use of TLS 1.0 by triggering ClientHello message fragmentation in communication between a client and server that both support later TLS versions, related to a "protocol downgrade" issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3511` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.5
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.5').
